City Manager

  • City Manager

Bill Hill has served as the City Manager for the City of Shavano Park since 2013.  Shavano Park is located in the San Antonio Metropolitan Area, approximately 12 miles north of downtown San Antonio. The City is a Type A General Law City operating under a Council / City Manager form of government consisting of five council members and an elected Mayor.  The City Manager supervises the staff, which is manned with professionals who are dedicated to our mission of providing outstanding customer service in a cost-effective manner. The city maintains its own water system, provides fire and EMS services, police protection, street maintenance, public works, and a municipal court.

While serving as the City Manager, the City of Shavano Park has received a number of recognitions and accomplishments.  These include:

  • In 2016, Shavano Park Fire and Water Department are awarded an ISO rating of 2, which places them in the top 10% in Texas and the top 3% across the United States.
  • Updated the Town Plan (in 2018 and 2023), which City Council approved by ordinance the as comprehensive planning documents to guide the City for the next 5-20 years
  • Extensive Economic Development along the two business district corridors (Loop 1604 and Lockhill Selma) and residential homes on the northside
  • Population growth from approximately 3,315 (2013) to 3,846 (2025) residents = 16% growth
  • Grand Total Net Taxable Value of all properties rose from $843,786,295 (2013) to $1,915,458,068 (2025) = 127% Growth
  • Average residence market value rose from $570,125 (2013) to $1,042,368 (2025) = 83% Growth
  • Guided by a citizens led committee, built a Pavilion, playground and nature trails as a community center on the Municipal Tract in 2020 – 2021 – a 2010 Town Plan goal
  • Partnered with TxDOT to reconstruct NW Military to improve traffic safety, add bike lanes and sidewalks – a 2010 Town Plan goal
  • Government Finance Officers Association Budget Award – Every year since 2015 (10 yrs)
  • Tree City USA recognition - Every year since 2016 (9 yrs)
  • Scenic City recognition (5-year certification) – 2016 & 2021
  • Firewise USA Community designation – Every year since 2016
  • In 2018, the City was recognized as the fourth community in Texas to be certified by the National Wildlife Federation as a certified “Community Wildlife Habitat”
  • In May 2019, the new aerial ladder truck was purchased and after training was officially put into service on July 2, 2019 – This significantly increased the ability of Shavano Park to combat fires
  • Developed a comprehensive street assessment and 20-year 4 phase reconstruction plan.  In 2022, four phase 1 projects worth $15M began, which included a $4M Community Development Grant from the Federal Government.  Phase 1 in expected to be complete in 2026 and Phase 2 is expected to begin in 2027

Prior to serving the City of Shavano Park, Bill served in the Army for 30 years retiring as a Colonel.  Key assignments included: the Chief of Staff at U.S. Army South, responsible for coordinating all Army activities in Central and South America; the Director of Operations for 3 Army which was responsible for coordinating Army support activities supporting Iraq, Afghanistan and across the Middle East; and serving as the City Manager (Garrison Commander) of Fort Hood (2007-2010) where 1 in 10 active army Soldiers were stationed during the war height of the war.

Bill is an active member of the Texas City Manager’s Association, where he served as the TCMA Region 8 President in 2017-18 and on the Board of Directors from 2020-2022.

He holds a BBA in Finance from Texas A&M University, a MBA in Individual Financial Planning from City University and a MS in National Security Strategy.  Bill and his wife, Kathleen have a son, Major Will Hill, U.S. Army, and 2 daughters, Mary Anna and Caroline and eight grandkids.
